page.title: 15ST.JAMES THE GREAT CONTINUED
page.content: The paintings show one of the few complete illustrations of the life and martyrdon of St. James to be found anywhere in Europe. The paintings tell the story of the conversion of Hermogeness the Magician and Philetus his disciple, by St.James. This success eventually leads to his execution at the hands of Herod Agrippa. Rather like the Bayeux Tapestry, the paintings have the appearance of a strip cartoon. the figures lack proportion but the identity of the characters is made easy by their elaborately patterned costumes and fantastic hats. Throughout the whole cycle , St. James wears ecclesiastical vestments and a Bishop's mitre.
